thread.title: CIS Roundup: Montreal Carabins hand Laval Rouge et Or first loss of season
thread.title_full: CIS Roundup: Montreal Carabins hand Laval Rouge et Or first loss of season - Winnipeg Free Press

author: The Canadian Press
title: CIS Roundup: Montreal Carabins hand Laval Rouge et Or first loss of season
text:
MONTREAL - Sean Thomas Erlington had 16 carries for 182 yards and a touchdown as the defending Vanier Cup champion Montreal Carabins topped the No. 2 ranked Laval Rouge et Or 22-16 on Saturday in Canadian Interuniversity Sport football action.
Thomas-Erlington started the scoring by completing a four-play, 68-yard drive with a 42-yard run to make it 7-0.
Quarterback Gabriel Cousineau was 21-of-29 passing for 251 yards while also running for a touchdown for the No. 4 Carabins (4-2).
Hugo Richard completed 25-of-42 passes for 276 yards, a touchdown and an interception for Laval (5-1).
---
VERT ET OR 45 REDMEN 10
SHERBROOKE, Que. — Jeremi Roch threw for 216 yards and three touchdowns while becoming the CIS all-time career-passing yards leader as No. 5 Sherbrooke (4-2) dominated McGill (3-3). The new national standard is now 10,964 yards.
---
X-MEN 30 HUSKIES 6
HALIFAX — Ashton Dickson had 23 carries for 136 yards and two touchdowns to lead St. Francis Xavier (2-3) past Saint Mary's (0-5).
---
MOUNTIES 38 AXEMEN 21
WOLFVILLE, N.S. — Kiel Ambursley ran for 131 yards and a pair of touchdowns as Mount Allison (4-2-0) downed Acadia (3-3-0).
---
VARSITY BLUES 34 WARRIORS 0
WATERLOO, Ont. — Alex Malone had 19 carries for 169 yards and two touchdowns as Toronto (3-4) got past Waterloo (0-7).
---
MUSTANGS 63 GEE-GEES 19
LONDON, Ont. — Yannick Harou ran in four touchdowns on 13 carries, while Alex Taylor had 19 carries for 195 yards and two touchdowns as No. 3 Western (7-0) routed Ottawa (2-5).
---
MARAUDERS 30 GOLDEN HAWKS 21
WATERLOO, Ont. — Asher Hastings threw three touchdowns in the first quarter and added another in the fourth as No. 6 McMaster (6-1) toppled Laurier (3-4).
---
GAELS 33 LIONS 32
TORONTO — Dillon Wamsley broke a tie with 1:42 remaining in the fourth quarter by kicking a 21-yard field goal as No. 10 Queen's (5-2) edged York (1-7).
---
GRYPHONS 41 LANCERS 27
GUELPH, Ont. — Jacob Scarfone caught 10 passes for 125 yards and two touchdowns as No. 7 Guelph (6-1) beat Windsor (1-7).
---
STINGERS 63 GAITERS 0
MONTREAL — Trenton Miller completed 29-of-41 passes for 388 yards and five touchdowns as Concordia (3-3) shut out Bishop's (1-5).
---
BISONS 49 RAMS 46
REGINA — Theo Deezar completed 29-of-39 passes for 339 yards and four touchdowns and Ryan Jones kicked a 41-yard field goal to put his team ahead for good as No. 8 Manitoba (4-2) slipped past the Rams (0-6).
---
THUNDERBIRDS 54 GOLDEN BEARS 10
VANCOUVER — Brandon Deschamps ran for three touchdowns on 16 carries for 176 yards as No. 9 UBC (4-2) routed Alberta (2-4).
---
